GONZO's FLAPPING AROUND -- absolutely no success. Something catches DUKE's eye... He REMAINS ROOTED -- his eyes turning to the VEGETAL PAISLEY PATTERNS ON THE CARPET WHICH ARE SHIFTING -- UNDULATING.  THE CARPET PATTERNS ARE INEXORABLY CREEPING UP THE WALLS...

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what about our room?  And the golf shoes? A GROUP OF REPTILES AT A TABLE ACROSS THE ROOM stares at them, BLOOD DRIPPING FROM THEIR FANGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grabbing GONZO trying to hold him still) Holy shit!  Look at that bunch over there!  They've spotted us!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cut to wider shot -- DUKE is holding on to a man standing next to him at the bar.  The room has returned to normality. GONZO is sitting in his original position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (downs his drink -- gets up) That's the press table.  Where you have to sign in for our credentials. Shit, let's get it over with.  You handle that, and I'll check on the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no.  Don't leave me! Black screen. INT. MINT HOTEL SUITE - DUSK A TELEVISION shows the NIGHTLY NEWS.  A BUDDHIST MONK, protesting the war, sets himself on fire.  A very nervous BELL BOY is laying out GONZO's order.  A marlin spike is on the floor next to DUKE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four club sandwiches, four shrimp cocktails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a big... machine in the sky... some kind of electric snake... DUKE is curled by the window -- MESMERIZED by an unseen neon sign outside the window.  His eyes fill with a million colored lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... a quart of rum...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... coming straight at us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoot it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not yet.  I want to study its habits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and nine fresh grapefruit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vitamin C.  We'll need all we can get. GONZO sees the BELL BOY out the door -- turns and lays into DUKE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, you've got to stop this talk about snakes and leeches and lizards and that stuff.  It's making me sick! DUKE stares -- hears the drone of B52 BOMBERS... On TV: The LAOS INVASION -- A SERIES OF HORRIFYING DISASTERS -- EXPLOSIONS AND TWISTED WRECKAGE. Newsreel footage of MAI LAI MASSACRE and the LIEUTENANT CALLEY court-martial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bastard!  They'll never let us back in that place.  I leave you alone for three minutes and you start waving that goddamn marlin spike around -- yelling about reptiles!  You scared the shit out of those people!  They were ready to call the cops.  Hell, the only reason they gave us press passes was to get you out of there... A knock at the door.  DUKE and GONZO break out in a sweat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God!  Who's that?! GONZO STICKS HIS GUN IN HIS WAISTBAND -- opens the door to LACERDA -- BOUNCING WITH PUPPY DOG ENTHUSIASM.  GONZO stares at a man he instantly hates -- watches him with deep suspicion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duke?  I'm Lacerda your photographer. Got your press passes?  Good, good. Too bad you missed the bikes checking in.  My, what a sight! DUKE watches the B-52S DROP THEIR BOMB LOADS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Looking down to the thick, patterned carpet, DUKE sees the BOMBS EXPLODE like vicious flowers. DUKE looks up: LACERDA is a war photographer -- bruised, filthy and blood spattered.  LACERDA approaches him -- talking a foreign language.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Husquavarnas.  Yamahas.  Kawaskis. Maicos.  Pursang.  Swedish Fireballs. Couple of Triumphs, here and there a CZ.  All very fast.  What a race it's gonna be. DUKE screws up his eyes -- WILLS NORMALITY BACK.  LACERDA is now just a keen photographer.L
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we start at dawn.  Get a good night's sleep.  I know I will. And with a cheerful wave, he's gone.  DUKE is in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (weakly) That's good...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think he's lying to us.  I could see it in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (even weaker) They'll probably have a big net for us when we show up. DUKE's attention returns to the devastation on the TV...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn that shit off! GONZO kills the TV. Black screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never lose sight of the primary responsibility.  Cover the story. But what was the story?  Nobody had bothered to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. DESERT - DAWN Against A BIG ORANGE SUN, on a concrete slab, MEN FIRE SHOTGUNS into the dawn sky.  Clay pigeons shatter.  The Mint Gun Club. Next to them, MOTORCYCLES REV -- preparing for the MINT 400 RACE: A hundred BIKERS, MECHANICS and assorted MOTORSPORT TYPES milling around in the pit area; taping headlights, topping off oil in the forks, last minute bolt tightening. DUKE wanders through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The racers were ready at dawn. Very tense.  But the race didn't start until nine so we had three long hours to kill. A sign by a long trestle table: "KOFFEE & DONUTS." DUKE walks past -- ignoring the SMILING LADY behind the stall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those of us who had been up all night were in no mood for coffee and donuts.  We wanted strong drink. We were, after all, the Absolute Cream of the National Sporting Press and we were gathered here, in Las Vegas, for a very special assignment.  And when it comes to things like this you don't fool around. INT. RACE BAR TENT - DAY A real pit of iniquity.  Slot Machines.  Crap tables.  Smoke. Drunken shouting.  The absolute cream of the NATIONAL SPORTING PRESS. DUKE is at the bar, engaged in drunken conversation with a LIFE REPORTER...showing him his notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See..."Kill the body and the head will die"... the Frazier/Ali fight...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A proper end to the 60's... Ali beaten by a human hamburger!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And both Kennedy's murdered by mutants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A SHOUT goes up from outside.  The sound of engines revving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it!  They're starting! In a sudden rush the PRESS CROWD make for the door taking DUKE with them. EXT. DESERT - DAY MOTORCYCLES REV -- tension builds... A flag goes down.  The CROWD cheers.  The MOTORCYCLES ROAR AWAY.  A great cloud of dust goes up -- obscuring the RACERS as they disappear into the desert... A moment...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's that.  They'll be back in an hour or so.  Let's go back to the bar. The CROWD turns and streams back into the tent. INT. RACE BAR TENT - DAY DUKE heads for the bar along with the REST.  It's packed. Drinks are ordered. A shout from outside the tent goes up:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Group 2! The CROWD rushes for the door.  DUKE gets swept along. EXT. DESERT - DAY MOTORCYCLES REV.  A flag goes down.  The CROWD cheers.  The MOTORCYCLES ROAR AWAY.  Another great cloud of dust goes up... The CROWD head back for the bar. INT. RACE BAR TENT - DAY The CROWD surge back to the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Group 3! This time DUKE fights his way free of the CROWD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was something like 190 more bikes waiting to start.  They were due to go off 10 at a time every 2 minutes. DUKE hits the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beer! A middle-aged HOODLUM in a T-shirt booms up to the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God damn!  What day is this -- Saturday?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More like Sunday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hah!  That's a bitch, ain't it? Last night I was home in Long Beach and somebody said they were runnin' the Mint 400 today, so I says to my old lady, "Man, I'm goin'." So she gives me a lot of crap about it, so I start slappin' her around, and the next thing you know two guys I never seen before are beating me stupid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Group 4! Outside, another batch of motorcycles roar away -- kicking up more clouds of dust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then they gave me ten bucks, put me on a bus, and when I woke up here I was in downtown Vegas, and for a minute all I could think was, "O Jesus, who's divorcing me this time?" But then I remembered, by God!  I was here for the Mint 400. And, man, I tell you, it's wonderful to be here.  Just wonderful to be here with you people. A silence.  A MAGAZINE REPORTER lunges across the bar -- grabs the BARTENDER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Senzaman wassyneeds!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smacks the bar with his palm) Hell yes!  Bring us ten!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Group 5!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (screams) I'll back it! (slides off his stool to the floor) Outside, motorcycles roar away.  The dust cloud billows into the tent -- getting denser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on the floor) This is a magic moment in sport! It may never come again!  I once did the Triple Crown, but it was nothing like this. A FROG-EYED WOMAN claws at the MAGAZINE REPORTER, tries to haul him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please stand up!  You're a correspondent for a major national magazine who's name we can't get clearance for!  Please!  You'd be a very handsome man if you'd just stand up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, madam.  I'm damn near intolerably handsome down here where I am.  You'd go crazy if I stood up! A feverishly eager LACERDA appears out of the dust cloud, 3 cameras slung round his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Club soda, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to MAGAZINE REPORTER) Please!  I love Life!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to DUKE) Man, it's great out there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lunatics. LACERDA grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Group 6!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meet you outside! LACERDA downs his drink -- hurries out through the crowd and out into the cloud of dust. EXT. DESERT - DAY Nothing.  Except for a THICK CLOUD OF DUST. Barely visible, a motorcycle comes speeding into the pits. The RIDER staggers off his bike.  The PIT CREW gas it up and sends it back with a FRESH RIDER. DUKE watches him disappear back into the dust cloud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By 10 they were spread out all over the course.  It was no longer a race, now it was an Endurance Contest.  The idea of trying to "cover this race" in any conventional press sense was absurd. A HORN HONKS.  A shiny BLACK BRONCO with DRIVER.  LACERDA hangs out of the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's great, isn't it?!  Jump in! DUKE gets into the Bronco and they head into the DUST CLOUD. EXT. DESERT - DAY IN THE BRONCO. DUKE hangs on with his beer.  Nothing all around but the HUGE IMPENETRABLE CLOUD OF DUST.  LACERDA snaps madly away at nothing at all!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll just keep trying different combos of film and lenses till I find one that works in this dust! The SOUND OF MOTORCYCLES RACING... We hear music and voices singing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...As we go marching on When I reach my final campground, in that land beyond the sun, And the Great Commander asks me..." [What did he ask you, Rusty?] "Did you fight or did you run?" A moment later, the Bronco races out of the dust.  DUKE coughs, chokes, drinks beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing) [And what did you tell them, Rusty?] "We responded to their rifle fire with everything we had..." The sound of gun shots... A DUNE BUGGY races toward them, loaded down with THREE RETIRED PETTY OFFICERS, DRUNK AS HELL.  The radio blares: "THE BATTLE HYMN OF LIEUTENANT CALLEY." The dune buggy is COVERED WITH OMINOUS SYMBOLS: SCREAMING EAGLES CARRYING AMERICAN FLAGS IN THEIR CLAWS.  A slant-eyed Snake being chopped to bits by a buzz-saw made of stars and stripes.  A MACHINE GUN MOUNT on the passenger side.  They yell over the roaring engines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the damn race?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beats me.  We're just good patriotic Americans like yourself. DUKE gives DUNE BUGGY PASSENGER #2 A NICE BIG GRIN.  In response, the PASSENGER #2 narrows his eyes -- tightens his grip on an automatic weapon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suspiciously) What outfit you fellas with?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sporting press.  We're friendlies.  Hired geeks. The DRIVER and DUNE BUGGY PASSENGER #2 exchange looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you want a good chase, you should get after that skunk from
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ROOM FILLED WITH REPTILES IN CLOTHES, DRINKING AND GNAWING AT ONE ANOTHER
IS SUDDENLY BACK -- AT DUKE'S SHOULDER
GROUP OF REPTILES AT A TABLE ACROSS THE ROOM
LAOS INVASION -- A SERIES OF HORRIFYING DISASTERS -- EXPLOSIONS AND TWISTED WRECKAGE
STICKS HIS GUN IN HIS WAISTBAND --
THREE RETIRED PETTY OFFICERS, DRUNK AS HELL
SCREAMING EAGLES CARRYING AMERICAN FLAGS IN THEIR CLAWS

direction.raw_text: News up ahead in the black jeep. He's the man responsible for that book, THE SELLING OF THE PENTAGON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A black jeep, you say? And they ROAR away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take me back to the pits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no -- we have to go on.  We need total coverage. DUKE gets out of the Bronco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're fired. After a moment's hesitation, LACERDA and the BRONCO driver roar away leaving DUKE alone in the cloud of dust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was time.  I felt, for an Agonizing Reappraisal of the whole scene.  The race was definitely under way.  I had witnessed the start; I was sure of that much. But what now? EXT. LAS VEGAS STREETS - NIGHT MUSIC PUMPS OUT.  CRUISING IN THE RED SHARK IN VEGAS.  THE SKY SWIRLS WITH MILLIONS OF NEON LIGHTS CHASING EACH OTHER IN BAROQUE PATTERNS ACROSS GIGANTIC HOTEL SIGNS.  PSYCHEDELIC LIGHT SHOWS TO LURE AND DERANGE THE INNOCENT.  CITY OF LOST SOULS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn up the radio!  Turn up the tape machine!  Roll the windows down.  Let's taste this cool desert wind!  Aaah, yes!  This is what it's all about! DUKE, beer in hand, drives -- a big smile for the world. GONZO scans The Vegas Visitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Total control now.  Tooling along the main drag on a Saturday night in Vegas, two good old boys in a fire apple red convertible... stoned, ripped, twisted... Good people!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about "Nickel Nick's Slot Arcade?" "Hot Slots," that sounds heavy.  Twenty-nine cent hotdogs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, what are we doing here?  Are we here to entertain ourselves, or to do the job?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To do the job, of course.  Here we go... a Crab Louie and quart of muscatel for twenty dollars! The Shark hits a bump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As your attorney I advise you to drive over to the Tropicana and pick up on Guy Lombardo.  He's in the Blue Room with his Royal Canadians. They hit another bump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why what? CUT to wide shot.  They are DRIVING AROUND IN CIRCLES in a large casino parking lot, bumping over the dividers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should I pay out my hard-earned dollars to watch a fucking corpse. I don't know about you, but in my line of business it's important to be Hep. EXT. DESERT ROOM HOTEL - NIGHT TWO BIG SCREAMING FACES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you doing?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't park here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?  Is this not a reasonable place to park? Reveal the RED SHARK parked on the sidewalk in front of the Desert Inn.  TWO DOORMEN loom over the car hood.  The MARQUEE says: TONIGHT.  DEBBIE REYNOLDS. GONZO leaps from the car, waving a five-dollar bill at the DOORMAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We want this car parked!  We drove all the way from L.A. for this show. We're friends of Debbie's. A pause, then... the DOORMAN pockets the bill, hands them a parking stub.  DUKE and GONZO hurry into the hotel. INT. DESERT FROM HOTEL LOBBY - NIGHT DUKE and GONZO walk through the lobby.  Black, mirrored, sleek, classy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit!  They almost had us there!  That was quick thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you expect?  I'm your attorney.  You owe me five bucks. I want it now. DUKE shrugs and hands over the $5.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was Bob Hope's turf.  Frank Sinatra's.  Spiro Agnew's.  It seemed inappropriate to be haggling about nickel/dime bribes for the parking lot attendant. A WINE-COLORED TUXEDO stops them at the entrance to the ballroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, full house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamnit, we drove all the way from L.A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said there are no seats left... at any price.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck seats!  We're old friends of Debbie's.  I used to romp with her. GONZO and the WINE-COLORED TUXEDO get into an ugly arm- waving negotiation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a lot of bad noise, he let us in for nothing provided we would stand quietly at the back and not smoke. As DUKE and GONZO disappear through the door we can hear the orchestra blasting out a HIGHLY BLANDIZED "SGT. PEPPER'S LONELY HEARTS CLUB BAND." A beat. The door flies open and BOUNCERS manhandle DUKE and GONZO out.  Despite the rough treatment they're both SCREECHING WITH LAUGHTER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus creeping shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tears streaming) Did the mescaline just kick in?  Or was that Debbie Reynolds in a silver Afro wig?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in hysteria) We wandered into a fucking time capsule! EXT. LAS VEGAS STREETS - NIGHT DUKE DRIVES FAST into the night.  They're both LAUGHING HYSTERICALLY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in hysteria) We wandered into a fucking time capsule! THEN... GONZO finds a TINY TEAR IN HIS JACKET...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this?... GONZO is instantly MOROSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That scum... GONZO twists round in the car -- SCREAMS back into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  I know where you live!  I'll find you and burn down your fucking house! EXT. BAZOOKO CIRCUS - NIGHT A hundred foot high neon clown: BAZOOKO CIRCUS. The RED SHARK pulls up beneath the sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the place.  They'll never fuck with us here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the ether?  This mescaline isn't working. EXT. BAZOOKO CIRCUS CASINO - NIGHT Into the GLARING, CHASING LIGHTS of the entrance canopy steps DUKE in EC/U holding a KLEENEX SOAKED IN ETHER TO HIS NOSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, devil ether.  It makes you behave like the village drunkard in some early Irish novel... total loss of all basic motor skills; blurred vision, no balance, numb tongue -- (throws away kleenex) The mind recoils in horror, unable to communicate with the spinal column.  Which is interesting, because you can actually watch yourself behaving in this terrible way, but you can't control it. DUKE and GONZO approach the entrance with elaborate care- taking one step at a time -- trying to keep ahead of the drug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You approach the turnstiles and know that when you get there, you have to give the man two dollars or he won't let you inside... but when you get there, everything goes wrong. THE ETHER KICKS IN: DUKE and GONZO BOUNCE off the walls, CRASH into OLD LADIES, GIGGLE HELPLESSLY as they try to pay -- HANDS FLAPPING CRAZILY, unable to get money out of their pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some angry Rotarian shoves you and you think: What's happening here? What's going on?  Then you hear yourself mumbling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mumbling) Dogs fucked the Pope, no fault of mine.  Watch out!... Why money?  My name is Brinks; I was born... Born?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get sheep over side... women and children to armored car... orders from Captain Zeep. The ATTENDANTS indulgently escort them through the TURNSTILES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ether is the perfect drug for Las Vegas.  In this town they love a drunk.  Fresh meat.  So they put us through the turnstiles and turned us loose inside. INT. BAZOOKO CIRCUS CASINO - NIGHT Flames shoot up from below the casino.  Above, a HIGH WIRE ACT with FOUR MUZZLED WOLVERINES, SIX NYMPHET SISTERS FROM SAN DIEGO, TWO SILVER PAINTED POLACK BROTHERS, and THREE KOREAN KITTENS. The WOLVERINE chases a NYMPHET through the air.  TWO POLACKS swing at it from opposite sides and they are instantly locked in a death battle. All plummet to the nets suspended over the GAMBLING TABLES and SLOT MACHINES.  No one looks up.  The GAMBLERS REMAIN INTENT ON THE SPINNING ROULETTE WHEEL, THE TURN OF THE CARD, THE ROLL OF A DICE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bazooko Circus is what the whole hep world would be doing Saturday night if the Nazis had won the war. This was the Sixth Reich. Something causes DUKE to look down.  A dwarf carrying drinks on a tray is tugging DUKE's pants leg trying to get him to move out of the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A drug person can learn to cope with things like seeing their dead grandmother crawling up their leg with a knife in her teeth but, nobody should be asked to handle this trip. GONZO and DUKE go upstairs walking past funhouse booths. One of them is manned by an orangutan in costume.  A FAIRGROUND BARKER grabs DUKE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stand in front of this fantastic machine, my friend.  For just 99 cents your likeness will appear 200 hundred feet tall on a screen above downtown Las Vegas. On a TV monitor a 200 FOOT HIGH DRUNKARD looms over the Las Vegas skyline screaming OBSCENITIES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cents more for a voice message. Say whatever you want, fella. They'll hear you, don't worry about that.  Remember, you'll be 200 feet tall!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Step right up!  Shoot the pasties off the nipples of this ten-foot bull-dyke and win a cotton candy goat! INT. BAZOOKO CIRCUS REVOLVING MERRY-GO-ROUND BAR - NIGHT DUKE and GONZO sit on the revolving platform.  GONZO stares -- glassy eyed -- coming apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate to say this, but this place is getting to me.  I think I'm getting The Fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nonsense.  We came here to find the American Dream, and now we're right in the vortex you want to quit. You must realize that we've found the Main Nerve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what gives me The Fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look over there.  Two women fucking a Polar Bear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, don't tell me those things... Not now. (signals the waitress for two Wild Turkeys) This is my last drink.  How much money can you lend me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not much.  Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  Leave the country.  Tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm down.  You'll be straight in a few hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  This is serious.  One more hour in this town and I'll kill somebody!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  I'll lend you some money. Let's go outside and see how much we have left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we make it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That depends on how many people we fuck with between here and the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to leave fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Lets pay this bill and get up very slowly.  It's going to be a long walk. (signals waitress who comes over)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suddenly to waitress) Do they pay you to screw that bear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's just kidding. (to GONZO) Come on, Doc -- lets go downstairs and gamble. GONZO trembles with fear -- walks to the edge of the turntable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When does this thing stop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It won't stop.  It's not ever going to stop. DUKE carefully steps off the turntable. GONZO, eyes staring blindly ahead, squiting in fear and confusion, rooted to the spot, is carried away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't move you'll come around. DUKE reaches out to grab GONZO, who jumps back -- keeps going around. The BARTENDER narrows his eyes at them. DUKE steps onto the merry-go-round -- hurries round the bar -- approaching GONZO from the blind side and shoves GONZO from behind.  GONZO goes down with a hellish scream. DUKE approaches him with his hands in the air.  Smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fell.  Let's go. GONZO refuses to move and stands tense, fists clenched, looking for somebody to hit...an old woman perhaps?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OK.  You stay here and go to jail. I'm leaving. DUKE walks fast towards the stairs.  GONZO catches up with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you see that?  Some sonofabitch kicked me in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably the bartender.  He wanted to stomp you for what you said to the waitress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good God!  Let's get out of here! Where's the elevator?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning him in the opposite direction) Don't go near that elevator. That's just what they want us to do... trap us in a steel box and take us down to the basement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. BAZOOKO CIRCUS CASINO - NIGHT DUKE and GONZO stumble out of the entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't run.  They'd like any excuse to shoot us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in an extended fall) You drive!  I think there's something wrong with me. INT. MINT HOTEL CORRIDOR OUTSIDE THEIR SUITE - NIGHT DUKE AND GONZO RUN MADLY DOWN THE CORRIDOR... DUKE TAKING CARE NOT TO STEP ON THE PATTERNED PART OF THE CARPET. GONZO STRUGGLES with the key in the lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those bastards have changed the lock on us.  They probably searched the room.  Jesus, we're finished! The door SUDDENLY SWINGS OPEN.  DUKE AND GONZO fall inside. INT. MINT HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT GONZO Bolt everything!  Use all chains! DUKE locks the door.  The suite is crowded with ROOM SERVICE GOODIES.  DUKE turns to see GONZO staring at two hotel room keys.  EVERYTHING STOPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did this one come from? DUKE snatches a key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Lacerda's room. GONZO smiles a slow smile...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... I thought we might need it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for? GONZO snatches the key back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go up there and blast him out of bed with the fire hose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we should leave the poor bastard alone.  I get the feeling that he's avoiding us for some reason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't kid yourself.  That Portuguese son of a bitch is dangerous.  He's watching us like a hawk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He told me he was turning in early... GONZO utters an anguished cry -- slaps the wall with both hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That dirty bastard!  I knew it! He's got hold of my woman!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing) That little blonde groupie with the film crew?  You think he sodomized her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, laugh about it!  You goddamn honkies are all the same! GONZO SLASHES A GRAPEFRUIT with a HUGE RAZOR SHARP HUNTING KNIFE.  DUKE blanches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you get that knife? GONZO SLICES THE GRAPEFRUIT -- MANIACAL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Room service sent it up.  I wanted something to cut the limes. GONZO SLICES THE GRAPEFRUIT -- INTO EIGHTHS!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What limes? GONZO SLICES -- SIXTEENTHS!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They didn't have any.  They don't grow in the desert. SLICE!  SLICE!  SLICE!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That dirty toad bastard!  I knew I should have taken him out when I had the chance.  Now he has her. SLICE!  SLICE!  SLICE!  GONZO SLASHES INSANELY! DUKE watches -- straight-faced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember the girl.  We'd had a problem with her in the elevator a few hours earlier: my attention had made a fool of himself. INT. ELEVATOR - DAY (FLASHBACK) An elevator door opens to reveal the SMILING FACES OF LACERDA, THE BLONDE TV REPORTER AND HER CREW. DUKE and GONZO stagger in. LACERDA drops his smile.  He's standing beside the BLONDE TV REPORTER.  A trembling GONZO moonily turns his eyes onto her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Gonzo) You must be a rider.  What class are you in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Class?  What the fuck do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you ride?  We're filming the race for a TV series -- maybe we can use you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Use me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother of God, I thought.  Here it comes. GONZO is TREMBLING BADLY.  There's a moment of uncomfortable silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suddenly shouting) I ride the BIG ONES!  The really
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CRUISING IN THE RED SHARK IN VEGAS
THE SKY SWIRLS WITH MILLIONS OF NEON LIGHTS CHASING EACH OTHER IN BAROQUE PATTERNS ACROSS GIGANTIC HOTEL SIGNS
PSYCHEDELIC LIGHT SHOWS TO LURE AND DERANGE THE INNOCENT
KLEENEX SOAKED IN ETHER TO HIS NOSE
FOUR MUZZLED WOLVERINES, SIX NYMPHET SISTERS FROM SAN DIEGO, TWO SILVER PAINTED POLACK BROTHERS,
GAMBLERS REMAIN INTENT ON THE SPINNING ROULETTE WHEEL, THE TURN OF THE CARD, THE ROLL OF A DICE
MINT HOTEL CORRIDOR OUTSIDE THEIR SUITE
NIGHT DUKE AND GONZO RUN MADLY DOWN THE CORRIDOR
DUKE TAKING CARE NOT TO STEP ON THE PATTERNED PART OF THE CARPET
SMILING FACES OF LACERDA, THE BLONDE TV REPORTER AND HER CREW

direction.raw_text: fuckers! GONZO shows his teeth to LACERDA.  DUKE laughs trying to defuse the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Vincent Black Shadow.  We're with the Factory Team.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit. GONZO stills -- becomes dangerous -- zeros in on the TV CAMERAMAN -- groin to groin...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute, pardon me lady, but I think there's some kind of ignorant chicken-sucker in this car who needs his face cut open.  You cheap honky faggots!  Which one of you wants to get cut?! DEAD SILENCE. Ding!  The elevator door opens, but nobody moves.  The door closes. Next floor.  Ding!  The door opens again.  A middle-aged couple start to get in.  Change their minds.  The door closes. INT. CORRIDOR - DAY DUKE and GONZO run down the corridor.  GONZO LAUGHS WILDLY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spooked!  They were spooked!  Like rats in a death cage! INT. MINT HOTEL SUITE - DAY DUKE and GONZO CRASH into their hotel suite -- BOLT THE DOOR. GONZO stops laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamn.  It's serious now.  That girl understood.  She fell in love with me. END FLASHBACK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MINT HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT SLICE!  SLICE!  SLICE!  GONZO with the BIG HUNTING KNIFE -- sliced grapefruit segments everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go up there and castrate that fucker! GONZO pauses -- A MAD THOUGHT -- turns to DUKE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (squinting suspiciously) Have you made a deal with him?  Did you put him on to her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (backing slowly towards the door) Look you better put that blade away and get your head straight.  I have to put the car in the lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the things you learn, after years of dealing with drug people, is that you can turn your back on a person, but never turn your back on a drug.  Especially when it's waving a razor-sharp hunting knife in your eyes. INT. CASINO/LOBBY MINT HOTEL The MAGAZINE REPORTER is on the telephone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Las Vegas at dawn.  The racers are still asleep, the dust is still on the desert, fifty thousand dollars in prize money, slumbers darkly in the office safe at Del Webb's fabulous Mint Hotel... DUKE walks past the REPORTER -- into THE CASINO, THE SAD, MEAGRE CROWDS AROUND THE CRAP TABLES.  No joy.  DUKE watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are these people?  These faces! Where do they come from?  They look like caricatures of used car dealers from Dallas. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And, sweet Jesus, there are a hell of a lot of them at four-thirty on a Monday morning.  Still humping the American dream, that vision of the big winner somehow emerging from the last minute predawn chaos of a stale Vegas casino. DUKE stops at the Money Wheel, puts down a two dollar bill on a number, the wheel turns, he loses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bastards!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Calm down.  Learn to ENJOY losing. INT. MINT HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT DUKE walks back into the room.  We hear the LOUD STRAINS OF THREE DOG NIGHT'S "JOY TO THE WORLD." He walks to the bathroom and opens the door. INT. MINT HOTEL SUITE BATHROOM - NIGHT Submerged in green water, GONZO WALLOWS in the steaming tub. Soap labels and grapefruit rinds float on the surface.  A large empty pack of Neutrogena soap lies on the floor.  The shower is on -- the tub overflowing.  THE TAPE RECORDER PLAYS, from where it's plugged into the razor socket over the sink. DUKE turns off the shower -- notices a HUGE HUNK OF CHEWED UP WHITE BLOTTER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ate ALL THIS ACID? No answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning down the volume) You evil son of a bitch.  You better hope there's some Thorazine in that bag, because if there's not, you're in bad trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Music!  Turn it up.  Put that tape on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What tape?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jefferson Airplane. "White Rabbit." I want a rising sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're doomed.  I'm leaving here in two hours and then they're going to come up here and beat the mortal shit out of you with big saps. Right there in that tub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dig my own graves.  Green water and the White Rabbit.  Put it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  But do me one last favor, will you.  Can you give me two hours? That's all I ask -- just two hours to sleep before tomorrow.  I suspect it's going to be a very difficult day. He switches on the tape. "WHITE RABBIT" begins to build.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (coolly) Of course, I'm your attorney, I'll give you all the time you need, at my normal rates: $45 an hour -- but you'll be wanting a cushion, so, why don't you just lay one of those $100 bills down there beside the radio, and fuck off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about a check?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever's right. DUKE moves the radio as far from the tub as he can and leaves, closing the door behind him. INT. MINT HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT DUKE goes across to the sofa and crashes -- exhausted. Suddenly a great ripping and crashing noise in the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help!  You bastard!  I need help!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUKE JUMPS up -- crosses to the bathroom door, muttering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, he's killing himself! INT. BATHROOM - NIGHT DUKE RUSHES IN.  GONZO flails -- trying to reach the radio with the shower curtain pole which he has ripped from its mounts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (snarling) I want that fucking radio! DUKE GRABS THE RADIO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't touch it!  Get back in that tub!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back the tape up.  I need it again! Let it roll!  Just as high as the fucker can go!  And when it comes to that fantastic note where the rabbit bites its own head off, I want you to THROW THAT FUCKING RADIO INTO THE TUB WITH ME! DUKE stares down at GONZO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not me.  It would blast you through the wall -- stone dead in ten seconds and they'd make me explain it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  Don't make me use this. HIS ARM LASHES OUT OF THE WATER, HOLDING THE KNIFE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it!  I want to get HIGHER! DUKE considers this.  He's had enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  You're right.  This is probably the only solution. (holds the PLUGGED IN TAPE/RADIO over the tub) Let me make sure I have it all lined up.  You want me to throw this thing into the tub when "WHITE RABBIT" peaks.  Is that it? GONZO falls back into the water, smiling gratefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck yes.  I was beginning to think I was going to have to go out and get one of the goddamn maids to do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you ready? He switches "WHITE RABBIT" back on.  GONZO HOWLS AND MOANS AND THRASHES TO THE MUSIC, straining to get over the top. Meanwhile, DUKE picks up a grapefruit from the sink -- a good two-pounder, he gets a grip on it... and when "WHITE RABBIT" peaks... HE HURLS IT INTO THE TUB LIKE A CANNONBALL. GONZO SCREAMS CRAZILY, THRASHING AND CHURNING -- CAUSING A TIDAL WAVE. DUKE JERKS THE RADIO CABLE OUT OF THE SOCKET -- SLAMS OUT OF THE BATHROOM. INT. MINT HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT DUKE slumps onto the sofa. SILENCE. GONZO RIPS OPEN THE BATHROOM DOOR, his eyes unfocused.  HE WAVES THE RAZOR SHARP BLADE out in front of him -- LUNGES at DUKE.  DUKE WHIPS OUT A CAN OF MACE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  YOU WANT THIS? GONZO stops -- hisses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bastard!  You'd do that, wouldn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs) Why worry?  You'll like it.  Nothing in the world like a Mace high. Forty-five minutes on your knees with the dry heaves...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You cheap honky sonofabitch...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?  Hell, just a minute ago, you were asking me to kill you! And now you want to kill me!  What I should do, goddamnit, is call the police!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cops?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no choice.  I wouldn't dare go to sleep with you wandering around with a head full of acid and wanting to slice me up with that goddamn knife!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mumbles) Who said anything about slicing you up?  I just wanted to carve a little Z on your forehead.  Nothing serious. GONZO shrugs and reaches for a cigarette on top of the TV set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (menaces him with the MACE) Get back in that tub.  Eat some reds and try to calm down.  Smoke some grass, shoot some smack -- shit, do whatever you have to do, but let me get some rest. GONZO turns toward the bathroom -- suddenly sad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, yes.  You really need some sleep.  You have to work.  Goddamn. What a bummer.  Try to rest.  Don't let me keep you up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GONZO shuffles back into the bathroom.  DUKE wedges a chair up against the bathroom doorknob and puts the mace can next to the clock. DUKE turns on the TV.  WHITE NOISE FILLS THE ROOM.  He collapses onto the sofa and lights up his lightbulb as pipe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ignore the nightmare in the bathroom. Just another ugly refugee from the Love Generation. The WHITE NOISE snow storm on the TV is reflected in his face.  The camera pulls back revealing THE ENTIRE WALL BEHIND HIM TO BE SWIRLING WITH THE FIZZING SNOWSTORM PATTERN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My attorney had never been able to accept the notion -- often espoused by former drug abusers -- that you can get a lot higher without drugs than with them.  And neither have
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: for that matter. The pattern on the wall changes to A 60'S VISCOUS OIL LIGHTSHOW PATTERN.  With DUKE still sitting in the foreground, the projected image widens to reveal the interior of A HAIGHT ASHBURY DANCE HALL full of DANCING PROTO-HIPPIES. INT. MATRIX CLUB - NIGHT A slightly YOUNGER DUKE moves through the throng.  All the action is in a DREAMLIKE SLOW-MOTION.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I recall one night in the Matrix. There I was -- a victim of the Drug Explosion.  A natural street freak, just eating whatever came by. A ROAD-PERSON with a big pack on his back is shouting.  The sound of his voice, like his movements, is in slow-motion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anybody want some L...S...D...?  I got all the makin's right here. All I need is a place to cook. The camera pushes right into the ROAD-PERSON's mouth. INT. MATRIX MEN'S ROOM - NIGHT Still in slow motion, the YOUNGER DUKE is trying to eat a HUGE SPANSULE OF ACID.  With difficulty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I decided to eat only half at first. Good thinking.  But I spilled the rest on the sleeve of my red Pendleton shirt. DUKE stares at his sleeve, uncertain what to do.  C/U of the door to the men's room as a MUSICIAN enters speaking in slow-motion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the trouble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (also in slow-motion) Well, all this white stuff on my sleeve is LSD. The MUSICIAN approaches and looks down at DUKE'S arm.  A long pause. Cut back to tight shot of door as it opens and a very clean- cut, PREPPY, STOCKBROKER TYPE enters.  He freezes in horror. We cut to his POV.  DUKE is standing in the middle of the men's room with the MUSICIAN hunkered down at his side... sucking on his sleeve.  A very gross tableau.  The STOCKBROKER slowly eases out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a bit of luck his life was ruined -- forever thinking that just behind some narrow door in all his favorite bars, men in red Pendleton shirts are getting incredible kicks from things he'll never know. INT. A BAR - YEARS LATER - NIGHT The STOCKBROKER LOOKING CONSIDERABLY OLDER sits looking lost, confused, a nervous wreck.  The image flares out in a TV white noise snowstorm. INT. MINT HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT DUKE sits staring at the TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strange memories on this nervous night in Las Vegas. (he gets up, pours himself a drink) Has it been five years?  Six?  It seems like a lifetime -- the kind of peak that never comes again. San Francisco in the middle sixties was a very special time and place to be a part of.  But no explanation, no mix of words or music or memories can touch that sense of knowing that you were there and alive in that corner of time and the world.  Whatever it meant. DUKE throws open the curtains.  Light streams in. EXT. 1965 STOCK FOOTAGE We are in SAN FRANCISCO.  IMAGES OF THE TIME FLOOD IN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THERE WAS MADNESS IN ANY DIRECTION, AT ANY HOUR... YOU COULD STRIKE SPARKS ANYWHERE.  THERE WAS A FANTASTIC UNIVERSAL SENSE THAT WHATEVER WE WERE DOING WAS RIGHT, THAT WE WERE WINNING.  AND THAT, I THINK, WAS THE HANDLE -- THAT SENSE OF INEVITABLE VICTORY OVER THE FORCES OF OLD AND EVIL.  NOT IN ANY MEAN OR MILITARY SENSE; WE DIDN'T NEED THAT.  OUR ENERGY WOULD SIMPLY prevail.  We had all the momentum; we were riding the crest of a high and beautiful wave... DUKE'S FACE IS SUFFUSED WITH A SADNESS AND SERENITY WE HAVE NEVER SEEN BEFORE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So now, less than five years later, you can go up on a steep hill in Las Vegas and look west, and with the right kind of eyes you can almost see the high water mark -- that place where the wave finally broke and rolled back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The memories dissolve into the night skyline of Vegas. Suddenly towering over the casinos is a 200 foot high Nazi shouting "WOODSTOCK UBER ALLES!" INT. MINT HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT DUKE closes the curtain.  The room is in darkness again. INT. MINT HOTEL SUITE - DAWN A harsh door buzzer.  DUKE jerks awake.  Alone.  Looking like shit.  Around him is the wreckage of their stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The decision to flee came suddenly. Or maybe not. DUKE opens the door to a BELL BOY with a trolley load of fruit, drinks and flowers... and a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Room service! The BELL BOY wheels the trolley across the room -- already stacked with EVEN MORE BOXES OF GOODIES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I'd planned it all along -- subconsciously waiting for the right moment.  The bill was a factor, I think.  Because I had no money to pay for it. DUKE slams the door -- starts FRANTICALLY PACKING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our room service tabs had been running somewhere between $29 and $36 per hour, for forty-eight consecutive hours.  Incredible. How could it happen? DUKE sees the DISCARDED WRAPPINGS OF EXPENSIVE, HAND TOOLED LUGGAGE.  A sudden thought.  He rushes to GONZO's room -- empty.  His plastic briefcase remains on the bed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But by the time I asked this question, there was no one around to answer. DUKE opens the briefcase -- finds the .357 MAGNUM inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My attorney was gone.  He must have sensed trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Panic. INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE HOTEL SUITE - DAY DUKE emerges with his bag and Gonzo's plastic briefcase -- leaves the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door -- checks both ways, then hurries away down the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It crept up my spine like first rising vibes of an acid frenzy. All these horrible realities began to dawn on me. INT. MINT HOTEL ELEVATOR - DAY An anxiety ridden DUKE watches the floor numbers as the elevator descends.  He searches his pockets...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here I was, alone in Las Vegas, with this goddamned incredibly expensive car, completely twisted on drugs, no cash, no story for the magazine.  And on top of everything else I had a gigantic goddamn hotel bill to deal with. DUKE finds a last crumpled $5 bill. The door opens.  A SECURITY GUARD enters with an OLD LADY IN HANDCUFFS. DUKE hides the bill -- crams back into the corner.  Doors close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't even know who had won the race.  Maybe nobody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MINT HOTEL LOBBY - DAY DUKE hurries out of the elevator -- eyes on a hovering MANAGER.  Past the curious look of the reception CLERK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (muttering to himself) How would Horatio Alger have handled this situation? EXT. MINT HOTEL - DAY Motoring, DUKE gives his $5 bill to the HOTEL FRONT DOORMAN with a smile.  The DOORMAN blows a frantic whistle and waves at the CAR BOY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay calm.  Stay calm.  I'm a relatively respectable citizen -- a multiple felon, perhaps, but certainly not dangerous. The CAR BOY pulls up with a screech.  DUKE jumps in.  The back seat is stacked with bars of Neutrogena, piles of Mint 400 t-shirts, boxes of grapefruit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luckily, I had taken the soap and grapefruit and other luggage out to the car a few hours earlier.  Now it was only a matter of slipping the noose... DUKE shifts into drive.  Deliverance!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUKE! DUKE freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Duke!  We've been looking for you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The game was up!  They had me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to himself) Well, why not?  Many fine books have been written in prison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Resigned, DUKE turns off the ignition.  A young CLERK arrives breathlessly with a smile and a YELLOW LETTER IN HIS HAND.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir? (thrusts out a TELEGRAM) This telegram came for you. Actually, it isn't for you.  It's for somebody named Thompson, but it says 'care of Raoul Duke'.  does that make sense?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (barely able to speak) Yes... It makes sense. DUKE stuffs the telegram into his top pocket. The CLERK peers into the car -- sees part of the enormous stash inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I checked the register for this man Thompson.  We don't show him but I figured he might be part of your team.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is.  Don't worry, I'll get it to him. He fires up the engine -- eases the RED SHARK into low gear. SECURITY GUARDS are looking across -- sharing a quiet word or two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What confused us was Dr. Gonzo's signature on the telegram from Los Angeles.  When we knew he was right here in the hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did the right thing.  Never try to understand a press message. About half the time we use codes -- especially with Dr. Gonzo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me.  When will the doctor be awake?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tenses) Awake?  What do you mean? DUKE's eyes are on the SECURITY GUARDS -- moving closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (uncomfortably) Well... the manager, Mr. Heem, would like to meet him.  Nothing unusual.  Mr. Heem likes to meet all our large accounts... put them on a personal basis... just a chat and a handshake, you understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.  But if I were you, I'd leave the Doctor alone until after he's eaten breakfast.  He's a very crude man. DUKE edges the car forward, but is stopped by the CLERK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he will be available?  Perhaps later this morning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look.  That telegram was all scrambled.  It was actually from Thompson, not to him.  Western Union must have gotten the names reversed.  I have to get going.  I have to get out to the track.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no hurry!  The race is over!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taking off) Not for me. He waves the CLERK off the car -- roars away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's have lunch!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Righto! EXT. ROAD OUT OF VEGAS - DAY DUKE drives the RED SHARK out of Vegas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A "YOU ARE LEAVING LAS VEGAS" sign flashes past. Bob Dylan plays: "Memphis Blues Again -- "Aaww, Mama, can this really by the end...?" A sign: LOS ANGELES -- 400 miles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, bad waves of paranoia, madness, fear and loathing -- intolerable vibrations in this place.  Get out!  The weasels were closing in.  I could smell the ugly brutes.  Flee! DUKE drives fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do me one last favor Lord: just give me five more high-speed hours before you bring the hammer down; just let me get rid of this goddamn car and off of this horrible desert. A sign flashes "YOU CAN RUN BUT YOU CAN'T HIDE." A patrol car pulls out behind him, lights flashing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You evil bastard!  This is your work!  You'd better take care of me, Lord... because if you don't you're going to have me on your hands. The patrol car screams after the RED SHARK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Few people understand the psychology of dealing with a Highway Traffic Cop.  Your normal speeder will panic and immediately pull over to the side.  This is wrong. DUKE floors the gas pedal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It arouses contempt in the cop heart. THE SPEEDOMETER CLIMBS STEADILY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make the bastard chase you.  He will follow.  But he won't know what to make of your blinker signal that says you're about to turn right. DUKE signals right.  The RED SHARK screams at 120 mph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is to let him know you're looking for a proper place to pull off and talk. AN EXIT OFF RAMP: MAX SPEED 25. DUKE hits the brakes.  The COP brakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will take him a moment to realize that he is about to make
direction.name: direction

THERE WAS A FANTASTIC UNIVERSAL SENSE THAT WHATEVER WE WERE DOING WAS RIGHT, THAT WE WERE WINNING
AND THAT, I THINK, WAS THE HANDLE -- THAT SENSE OF INEVITABLE VICTORY OVER THE FORCES OF OLD AND EVIL
NOT IN ANY MEAN OR MILITARY SENSE

result.heading: FACE IS SUFFUSED WITH A SADNESS AND SERENITY WE HAVE NEVER SEEN BEFORE
