dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LAS VEGAS AIRPORT - DAY GONZO WAVES GOODBYE as he boards an airplane with a set of brand-new fine cowhide luggage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: "YOU CAN RUN BUT YOU CAN'T HIDE

direction.raw_text: degree turn at speed... but you will be ready for it, braced for the G's and the fast heel toe work. The patrol car spins and fishtails crazily out of control. EXT. SCENIC PICNIC AREA - DAY The patrol car comes skidding around the corner.  DUKE stands beside the RED SHARK, completely relaxed and smiling. The HIGHWAY PATROLMAN gets out of the car, screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just what the FUCK did you think you were doing?! DUKE smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I see your license.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, officer. DUKE reaches for it.  And BOTH MEN look down at a beer can -- which DUKE had, somehow, forgotten was in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew I was fucked. The COP relaxes -- actually smiles... He reaches out for DUKE's wallet, then holds out his other hand for the beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could I have that, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?  It was getting warm anyway. The HIGHWAY PATROLMAN takes it, pours out the beer -- glances in the back seat of the RED SHARK.  Amongst the bars of soap... A case of warm beer.  DUKE smiles back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You realize...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  I know.  I'm guilty.  I understand that.  I knew it was a crime but I did it anyway.  Shit, why argue?  I'm a fucking criminal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a strange attitude. He looks at DUKE thoughtfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know -- I get the feeling you could use a nap.  There's a rest area up ahead.  Why don't you pull over and sleep a few hours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A nap won't help.  I've been awake for too long -- three or four nights.  I can't even remember.  If I go to sleep now, I'm dead for twenty hours. The HIGHWAY PATROLMAN smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  Here's how it is.  What goes into my book, as of noon, is that I apprehended you... for driving too fast, and advised you to proceed no further than the next rest area... your stated destination, right? Where you plan to take a long nap. Do I make myself clear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far is Baker?  I was hoping to stop there for lunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not my jurisdiction.  The city limits are two point two miles beyond the rest area.  Can you make it that far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll try.  I've been wanting to go to Baker for a long time.  I've heard a lot about it. The PATROLMAN holds the door for DUKE who gets in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent seafood.  With a mind like yours, you'll probably want to try the land-crab.  Try the Majestic Diner. The PATROLMAN slams the door shut. EXT. DESERT ROAD - DAY DUKE drives away -- teeth gritted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I felt raped.  The Pig had done me on all fronts, and now he was going off to chuckle about it -- on the west side of town, waiting for me to make a run for L.A. DUKE drives past the rest area to an intersection where he signals to turn right into Baker.  As he approaches the turn he sees the HITCHHIKER!  As DUKE slows to make the turn their eyes meet.  DUKE is about to wave -- but the HITCHHIKER drops his thumb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great Jesus, it's him. DUKE, spooked, SPINS THE RED SHARK round -- ROARS BACK THE WAY HE CAME. EXT. BAKER TRUCK STOP - DAY DUKE on the public phone booth -- screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've nailed me!  I'm trapped in some stinking desert crossroads called Baker.  I don't have much time.  The fuckers are closing in. They'll hunt me down like a beast!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. GONZO'S OFFICE - DAY GONZO sits surrounded by legal papers and law books.  Mexican Day of the Dead masks hang from the walls -- flame-red demons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?  You sound a little paranoid. EXT. BAKER TRUCK STOP - DAY DUKE screams -- sweat pouring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bastard!  I need a lawyer immediately! INT. GONZO'S OFFICE - DAY GONZO What are you doing in Baker? Didn't you get my telegram? EXT. BAKER TRUCK STOP - DAY DUKE What?  Fuck telegrams.  I'm in trouble.  You worthless bastard. I'll cripple your ass for this! All that shit in the car is yours! You understand that?  When I finish testifying out here you'll be disbarred! INT. GONZO'S OFFICE - DAY GONZO You're supposed to be in Vegas.  We have a suite at the Flamingo.  I was just about to leave for the airport. INT. BAKER TRUCK STOP - DAY DUKE pulls out the telegram from his top pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You brainless scumbag!  You're supposed to be covering the National District Attorney's conference!  I made all the reservations... rented a white Cadillac convertible... the whole thing is arranged!  What the hell are you doing out there in the middle of the fucking desert?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUKE stares at the telegram.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never mind.  It's all a big joke. I'm actually sitting beside the pool at the Flamingo.  I'm talking from a portable phone.  Some dwarf brought it out from the casino.  I have total credit!  Can you grasp that? (shouts) Don't come anywhere near this place! Foreigners aren't welcome here! DUKE, breathing heavily, hangs up phone. EXT. DESERT - DAY C/U of .357 Magnum cylinder being spun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well.  This is how the world works. C/U An IGUANA basks in the sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All energy flows according to the whims of the Great Magnet. C/U Barrel of the gun.  It fires.  An explosion of desert dirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a fool I was to defy Him. The IGUANA sits unfazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never cross the Great Magnet.  I understood this now... (another blast from the gun) ... and with understanding came a sense of almost terminal relief. DUKE stands alone in the vast desert firing at nothing, the thuds of the explosions echo away. EXT. ROAD INTO VEGAS - DAY The RED SHARK driving back towards Las Vegas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had to get rid of The Shark.  Too many people might recognize it... ...especially the Vegas Police. (tight C/U of DUKE) Luckily, my credit card was still technically valid. PULL BACK TO REVEAL: DUKE, now driving a white Cadillac Coupe de Ville -- THE WHITE WHALE. DUKE pushes buttons -- lowers the top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was a superior machine -- ten grand worth of gimmicks and high price special effects.  The rear windows leapt up with a touch like frogs in a dynamited pond.  The dashboard was full of esoteric lights and dials and meters that I would never understand. EXT. FLAMINGO HOTEL - AFTERNOON A GIANT SIGN: THE FLAMINGO WELCOMES THE NATIONAL DA'S CONFERENCE ON NARCOTICS & DANGEROUS DRUGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If the Pigs were gathering in Vegas, I felt the Drug Culture should be represented as well... and there was a certain bent appeal in the notion of running a savage burn on one Las Vegas hotel and then just wheeling across town and checking into another. The WHITE WHALE turns into a VIP parking slot, immediately attended by impressed MINIONS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me and a thousand ranking cops from all over America.  Why not?  Move confidently into their midst. INT. FLAMINGO HOTEL LOBBY - AFTERNOON DUKE enters -- old Levis, grubby sneakers, 10 peso Acapulco shirt coming apart at the seams, 3 day growth, eyes hidden behind mirror shades.  He heads for the check-in line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My arrival was badly timed. THE PLACE IS FULL OF COPS.  200 of them, on vacation, all dressed in cut price Vegas casuals: plaid Bermuda shorts, Arnie Palmer golf shirts, and rubberized beach sandals. Ahead of DUKE -- A POLICE CHIEF argues with the DESK CLERK. The POLICE CHIEF'S AGNEW STYLE WIFE stands to the side, weeping.  The POLICE CHIEF'S FRIENDS stand uneasily around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean I'm too late to register?  I'm a police chief. From Michigan.  Look, fella, I told you. (waves a POSTCARD) I have a postcard here that says I have reservations in this hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (prissily) I'm sorry, sir.  You're on the "late list." Your reservations were transferred to the... ah... Moonlight Motel, which is out on Paradise Boulevard...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've already paid for my goddamn room!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's actually a very fine place of lodging and only sixteen blocks from here, with its own pool and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You dirty little faggot!  Call the manager!  I'm tired of listening to this dogshit! FRIENDS restrain the POLICE CHIEF.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (solicitously) I'm so sorry, sir.  May I call you a cab? The POLICE CHIEF's screamed insults fade away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, I could hear what the Clerk was really saying...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, you fuzzy little shithead -- I've been fucked around, in my time, by a fairly good cross- section of mean-tempered rule-crazy cops and now it's MY turn. "Fuck you, officer, I'm in charge here, and I'm telling you we don't have room for you." DUKE steps to the desk, around the raging POLICE CHIEF.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say.  I hate to interrupt, but I wonder if maybe I could just sort of slide through and get out of your way.  Name's Raoul Duke -- Raoul Duke.  My attorney made the reservation. DUKE snaps a credit card down onto the counter.  EVERYONE goes silent.  The POLICE CHIEF GROUP stares at him like he was some kid of water rat crawling up to the desk.  The CLERK hits the bell for the BELLBOY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly, Mr. Duke!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My bags are out there in that white Cadillac convertible.  Can you have someone drive it around to the room? ALL EYES turn to the gleaming WHITE WHALE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, and could I get a quart of Wild Turkey, two fifths of Baccardi, and a night's worth of ice delivered to my room, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about a thing, sir. Just enjoy your stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, thank you. DUKE gives the POLICE CHIEF a polite smile -- crosses to the elevator -- turns to face the GAWPING COPS -- pops a can of beer and toasts them.  The doors close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HOTEL FLAMINGO - CORRIDOR OUTSIDE SUITE - DAY DUKE rams the key home -- swings the door open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, home at last! INT. HOTEL FLAMINGO SUITE - AFTERNOON DUKE enters.  The door hits something with a thud. A 16-year-old GIRL with the aura of an angry Pit Bull. GONZO stands in the bathroom doorway -- stark naked with a drug-addled grin on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You degenerate pig!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can't be helped.  This is Lucy. (laughing distractedly) You know--like "Lucy In The Sky With Diamonds." LUCY eyes DUKE venomously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucy!  Lucy, be cool, goddamnit! Remember what happened at the airport!  No more of that, okay? LUCY keeps her eyes on DUKE.  GONZO idles over and puts his arm round her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucy... this is my client.  This is Mr. Duke, the famous journalist. He's paying for this suite, Lucy. He's on our side. DUKE flops onto the sofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Duke is my friend.  He loves artists. DUKE notices for the first time that the room is full of artwork.  Maybe 40 or 50 portraits, some in oil, some in charcoal, all more or less the same size and same face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucy paints portraits of Barbra Streisand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I drew these from TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fantastic.  She came all the way down here from Montana just to give these portraits to Barbra.  We're going over to the Americana Hotel tonight to meet her backstage... DUKE's voice rises above GONZO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I desperately needed peace, rest, sanctuary.  I hadn't counted on this.  Finding my attorney on acid and locked into some kind of preternatural courtship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I guess they brought the car round by now.  LET'S GET THE STUFF OUT OF THE TRUNK. DUKE fixes GONZO hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely, LET'S GET THE STUFF. (to LUCY) Now, we'll be right back.  Don't answer the phone if it rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (makes one-fingered Jesus freak sign) God bless. INT. FLAMINGO HOTEL - CORRIDOR OUTSIDE SUITE - DAY DUKE collars GONZO -- serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ?  What are your plans?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plans?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (struggling to focus) Shit.  I met her on the plane and I had all that acid. (he shrugs) You know, those little blue barrels. I gave her a cap before I realized... she's a religious freak... Jesus, she's never even had a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... It'll probably work out. We can keep her loaded and peddle her ass at the drug convention. GONZO stares uneasily at DUKE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, she's running away from home for something like the fifth time in six months.  It's terrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's perfect for this gig.  These cops will go fifty bucks a head to beat her into submission and then gang fuck her.  We can set her up in one of these back street motels, hang pictures of Jesus all over the room, then turn these pigs loose on her... Hell she's strong; she'll hold her own. GONZO's face twitches badly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ.  I knew you were sick but I never expected to hear you actually say that kind of stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's straight economics.  This girl is a god-send.  Shit, she can make us a grand a day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  Stop talking like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figure she can do about four at a time.  Christ, if we keep her full of acid that's more like two grand a day.  Maybe three.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You filthy bastard.  I should cave your fucking head in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a few hours, she'll probably be sane enough to work herself into a towering Jesus-based rage at the hazy recollection of being seduced by some kind of cruel Samoan who fed her liquor and LSD, dragged her to a Vegas hotel room and savagely penetrated every orifice in her body with his throbbing, uncircumcised member. GONZO starts crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  I felt sorry for the girl, I wanted to help her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll go straight to the gas chamber.  And even if you manage to beat that, they'll send you back to Nevada for Rape and Consensual Sodomy.  She's got to go. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, it doesn't pay to try to help somebody these days. A silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only alternative was to take her out to the desert and feed her remains to the lizards.  But, it seemed a bit heavy for the thing we were trying to protect: My attorney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to cut her loose.  She's got two hundred dollars.  And we can always call the cops up there in Montana, where she lives, and turn her in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?... What kind of goddamn monster are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It just occurred to me, that she has no witnesses.  Anything that she says about us is completely worthless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Us? INT. HOTEL FLAMINGO SUITE - SUNSET DUKE is speaking into the phone in hushed tones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hotel Americana?  I need a reservation.  For my niece.  Listen, I need her treated very gently. She's an artist, and might seem a trifle highstrung... In the background GONZO helps LUCY and her paintings out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Lucy, it's time to go meet Barbra...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I felt like a Nazi, but it had to be done. EXT. ON THE STREETS - A CAB STAND - DUSK The WHITE WHALE pulls up -- DUKE at the wheel.  GONZO helps LUCY and her paintings from the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucy was a potentially fatal millstone on both our necks.  There was absolutely no choice but to cut her adrift and hope her memory was fucked. GONZO unrolls a couple of bills -- pays off a CAB DRIVER -- waves to LUCY in the back with her paintings.  She's starting to come down... GONZO gets back in the WHITE WHALE and slaps his hands together as if washing his hands of the situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well that's that.  Take off slowly. Don't attract attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They pull out into traffic. EXT. LAS VEGAS STREETS - DUSK GONZO I gave the cabbie an extra ten bucks to make sure she gets there safe.  Also, I told him I'd be there myself in an hour, and if she wasn't, I'd come back out here and rip his lungs out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good.  You can't be subtle in this town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As your attorney, I advise you to tell me where you put the goddamn mescaline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should take it easy tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.  Let's find a good seafood restaurant and eat some red salmon. I feel a powerful lust for red salmon... The electric WHITE WHALE heads off down the Strip.  The sun's going down behind the scrub hills, a good Kristofferson tune croaks on the radio in the warm dusk. INT. HOTEL FLAMINGO SUITE - BATHROOM - NEXT MORNING GONZO throws up in the toilet bowl. In the background, DUKE opens curtains.  Daylight blinds him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, we're going to be late. GONZO looks up at his sick reflection -- wipes his mouth with a towel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This goddamn mescaline.  Why the fuck can't they make it a little less pure?  Maybe mix it up with Rolaids or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HOTEL BALLROOM - DAY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR (crackling and booming over the lousy sound system) On behalf of the prosecuting attorneys of this county, I welcome you to the Third National DA's Conference on Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs. The EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR -- well groomed, GOP businessman type -- speaks from the podium.  A banner behind him reads: NATIONAL DA'S CONVENTION 1971. "If You Don't Know, Come To Learn... If You Know, Come To Teach." A BIG MIXED CROWD: TOP LEVEL STRAIGHT COPS, UNDERCOVER NARCS AND OTHER TWILIGHT TYPES -- beards, mustaches and super-Mod dress.  Just because you're a cop, doesn't mean you can't be WITH IT!  However, for every URBAN-HIPSTER there are around 20 REDNECKS. A dozen big, low-fidelity speakers mounted on steel poles distort and feed back the EXECUTIVE's voice through the room. At the back, under a loudspeaker, sits DUKE -- $40 FBI wingtips, a Pat Boone madras sportcoat, and an official name tag: RAOUL DUKE, PRIVATE INVESTIGATOR, L.A. GONZO sits beside him.  His name tag: DR. GONZO.  EXPERT, CRIMINAL DRUG ANALYSIS.  He's nervous -- close to the edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (lowers his voice) I saw these bastards in Easy Rider, but I didn't believe they were real. Not like this.  Not hundreds of them!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're actually nice people when you get to know them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, I know these people in my goddamn blood!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't mention that word around here. You'll get them excited.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a fucking nightmare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.  Sure as hell some dope- dealing bomb freak is going to recognize you and put the word out that you're partying with a thousand cops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! DR. BLUMQUIST -- a "drug expert" -- takes the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We must come to terms with the Drug Culture in the country... country... country... The sound systems echoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The reefer butt is called a "roach," because it resembles a cockroach... cockroach... cockroach...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispers) What the fuck are these people talking about?  You'd have to be crazy on acid to think a joint looked like a goddamn cockroach!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was clear that we had stumbled into a prehistoric gathering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, there are four states of being in the cannabis, or marijuana, society: Cool, Groovy, Hip, and Square.  The square is seldom if ever cool.  He is not "with it," that is, he doesn't know "what's happening." But if he manages to figure it out, he moves up a notch to "hip." DUKE and GONZO listen in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if he can bring himself to approve of what is happening, he becomes "groovy." After that, with much luck and perseverance, he can rise to the rank of "cool." A cool guy... cool guy... cool guy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Bloomquist, do you think the anthropologist, Margaret Mead's strange behavior of late might possibly be explained by a private marijuana addiction?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really don't know, but at her age, if she did smoke grass, she'd have one hell of a trip! Roars of laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know a hell of a lot better ways to waste my time than listening to this bullshit. He stands, knocking the ashtray off his chair arm, and plunges down the aisle to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Down in front!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you!  I have to get out!  I don't belong here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good riddance! He stumbles from the room.  DUKE turns his attention back to the stage. The lights go down.  A black & white film -- REEFER MADNESS! -- illustrates his now evangelical talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  YOUR LIFE MAY DEPEND ON IT!  You will not be able to see his eyes because of Tea-Shades, but his knuckles will be white from inner tension... DUKE turns his attention to a 340 pound TEXAN POLICE CHIEF who necks with his 290 pound WIFE beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and his pants will be crusted with semen from constantly jacking off when he can't find a rape victim...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUKE gazes at the TEXAN and his WIFE. -- Feigning sickness, he gets up, hand over mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pardon me, I feel sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He will stagger and babble when questioned.  He will not respect your badge.  The Dope Fiend fears nothing.  He will attack, for no reason, with every weapon at his command -- including yours... DUKE heads for the exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, sick... Beg pardon!  Feeling sick...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Any officer apprehending a suspected marijuana addict should use all necessary force immediately. One stitch in time [on him] will usually save nine on you. DUKE CRASHES OUT THROUGH THE DOOR. INT. CASINO BAR - DAY DUKE sees GONZO at the bar -- talking to a SPORTY LOOKING COP about 40 whose name tag identifies him as a DISTRICT ATTORNEY FROM GEORGIA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a whiskey man myself.  We don't have much trouble from drugs where I come from...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will.  One of these nights you'll wake up and find a junkie tearing your bedroom apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll climb right into your bedroom and sit on your chest with big Bowie knives.  They might even sit on your wife's chest.  Put the blade right down on her throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not down in my parts. DUKE joins them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to WAITRESS) Rum and ice, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looks at DUKE'S NAME TAG) You're another one of these California boys.  Your friend here's been tellin' us about dope fiends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're everywhere.  Nobody's safe. And sure as hell not in the South. They like warm weather... You'd never believe it.  In L.A. it's out of control.  First it was drugs, now it's witchcraft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Witchcraft?  Shit, you can't mean it! The BARTENDER cleans his glasses, one ear straining for the conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Read the newspapers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, you don't know trouble until you have to face down a bunch of these addicts gone crazy for human sacrifice!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw!  That's science fiction stuff!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not where we operate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, in Malibu alone, these goddamn Satan worshippers kill six or eight people every day.  All they want is the blood.  They'll take people right off the street if they have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just the other day we had a case where they grabbed a girl right out of a McDonald's hamburger stand. She was a waitress, about sixteen years old... with a lot of people watching, too! The BARTENDER keeps cleaning the same glass -- more and more furiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?  What did they do to her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do?  Jesus Christ, man.  They chopped her goddamn head off right there in the parking lot!  Then they cut all kinds of holes in her head and sucked out the blood!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (DA ad-libs a summation of the crime) And nobody did anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What could they do?  The guy that took the head was about six-seven, and maybe three-hundred pounds.  He was packing two Lugers, and the others had M-16s.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They just ran back out into Death Valley -- you know, where Manson turned up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like big lizards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and every one of them stacked naked...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naked!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeh, naked!... except for the weapons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were all veterans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Veterans?!!!? Agog with the horrors of the story, the BARTENDER polishes the glass -- faster and faster...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeh.  The big guy used to be a major in the Marines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A major!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We know where he lives, but we can't get near the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw!  Not a major.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wanted the pineal gland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how he got so big.  When he quit the Marines he was just a little guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Usually, it's whole families. During the night.  Most of them don't even wake up until they feel their heads going -- and then, of course, it's too late. The glass smashes in the BARTENDER's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happens every day. DUKE turns to a WAITRESS with a warm smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three more rums.  Plenty of ice. Maybe a handful of lime chunks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you guys with the police convention upstairs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We sure are, Miss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought so.  I never heard that kind of talk around here before. Jesus Christ!  How do you guys stand that kind of work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grinning) We like it.  It's groovy. The WAITRESS stares -- sickened -- at GONZO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with you?  Hell, somebody has to do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry up with those drinks.  We're thirsty.  Only two rums.  Make mine a Bloody Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whacks his fist on the bar) Hell, I really hate to hear this. Because everything that happens in California seems to get down our way, sooner or later.  Mostly Atlanta.  But that was back when the goddamn bastards were peaceful. All we had to do was to keep 'em under surveillance.  They didn't roam around much... But now Jesus, it seems nobody's safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a conspiratorial nod) You're going to need to take the bull by the horns -- go to the mat with this scum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean by that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I mean.  We've done it before and we can damn well do it again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut their goddamn heads off.  Every one of them.  That's what we're doing in California.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stupefied)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.  It's all on the Q.T., but everybody who matters is with us all the way down the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We keep it quiet.  It's not the kind of thing you'd want to talk about upstairs.  Not with the press around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (recovering slightly) Hell, no.  We'd never hear the goddamn end of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dobermans don't talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes it's easier to just rip out the backstraps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll fight like hell if you try to take the head without the dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God almighty! (muttering in a daze) I don't think I should tell my wife about this.  She'd never understand. You know how women are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUKE gives the DA a brotherly slap on the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just be thankful your heart is young and strong. DUKE and GONZO leave the stunned DA -- staring into the swirling ice in drink. INT. HOTEL FLAMINGO SUITE - DAY DUKE and GONZO fall into the suite in fits of laughter. GONZO feels the nausea rise suddenly -- heads for the bathroom.  Immediate sounds of retching. The phone message light is blinking.  DUKE opens a beer, picks up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the message?  My light is blinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, yes.  Mr. Duke?  You have one message: "Call Lucy at the Americana Hotel, room 1600."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit! DUKE slams the phone down.  GONZO emerges from the bathroom -- looking like death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucy called. GONZO sags visibly -- like an animal taking a bullet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? The telephone rings.  DUKE answers. INT. FLAMINGO HOTEL - RECEPTION - DAY A worried CLERK speaks in to the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Duke?  Hello, Mr. Duke, I'm sorry we were cut off a moment ago... I thought I should call again, because I was wondering...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. FLAMINGO HOTEL SUITE - DAY DUKE WHAT? (hand over the PHONE) What was that crazy bitch said to him? (screams) There's a war on, man!  People are being killed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Killed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  ON THE GODDAMN TELEVISION!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... yes... yes... This terrible war.  When will it end?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me.  What do you want? In the background GONZO is upturning a sofa to retrieve his stash from the lining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The woman who left that message for you sounded very disturbed.  I think she was crying...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crying?  Why was she crying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, uh.  She didn't say Mr. Duke. But since I know you're here with the Police Convention...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, you want to be gentle with that woman if she ever calls again. We're watching her very carefully... this woman has been into laudanum. It's a controlled experiment, but I suspect we'll need your cooperation before this thing is over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hesitantly) Well, certainly... We're always happy to cooperate with the police...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry.  You're protected. Just treat this poor woman like you'd treat any other human being in trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?  Ah... yes, yes, I see what you mean... Yes... so, you'll be responsible then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.  And now I have to get back to the news.  Send up some ice. He hangs up.  GONZO zaps TV channels -- commercials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good work.  They'll treat us like goddamn lepers after that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (slowly, carefully) Lucy is looking for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing) No, she's looking for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She really flipped over you.  The only way I could get rid of her was by saying you were taking me out to the desert for a showdown -- that you wanted me out of the way so you could have her all to yourself. (laughing again) I guess she figures you won.  That phone message wasn't for me, was it? A look of stunned realization from DUKE... INT. FANTASY COURT ROOM - DAY LUCY is on the witness stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir, those two men in the dock are the ones who gave me the LSD and took me to the hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A doomed DUKE and GONZO await their fate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know for sure what they done to me, but I remember it was horrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty years... and Double Castration! The JUDGE bangs his gavel. INT. HOTEL FLAMINGO SUITE - DAY DUKE is madly stuffing his suitcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait!  You can't leave me alone in this snake pit.  This room is in my name. DUKE KEEPS PACKING.  GONZO is looking worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goddamnit!... Look... I'll call her.  I'll get her off our backs. You're right.  She's my problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gone too far.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax.  Let me handle this. (dials the PHONE, snaps angrily at DUKE) You'd make a piss-poor lawyer. ...Room 1600, please. (to DUKE) As your attorney, I advise you not to worry. (nods towards bathroom) Take a hit out of that little brown bottle in my shaving kit. DUKE goes in the bathroom.  He finds a little bottle -- a label: "DRINK ME."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't need much.  Just a little tiny taste, that stuff makes pure mescaline seem like ginger-beer. Adrenochrome. DUKE stares wonderingly at the bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adrenochrome...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into PHONE) Hi, Lucy?  Yeah, it's me.  I got your message...what?  Hell, no, I taught the bastard a lesson he'll never forget... what?  No, not dead, but he won't be bothering anybody for a while.  Yeah.  I left him out there, I stomped him, then pulled all his teeth out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember thinking, "Jesus, what a terrible thing to lay on somebody with a head full of acid." DUKE dips a match head into the brown bottle -- studies it -- TASTES IT -- NOTHING -- TASTES SOME MORE...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to PHONE) But here's the problem.  That bastard cashed a bad check downstairs and gave you as a reference.  They'll be looking for both of you.  Yeah, I know, but you can't judge a book by its cover, Lucy.  Some people are just basically rotten... Anyway, the last thing you want to do is call this hotel again; they'll trace the call and put you straight behind bars... no, I'm moving to the Tropicana right away.  I have to go, they've got the phone tapped. Yeah, I know, it was horrible, but it's all over now... OH MY GOD!
direction.name: direction

result.heading: -- TASTES IT -- NOTHING -- TASTES SOME MORE

direction.raw_text: ! (throws the PHONE down; shouts) No!  Get away from me!  I'm innocent! It was Duke!  I swear to God! (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stomps the PHONE; moans) No, I don't know where she is. You'll never catch Lucy!  She's gone!  I swear, I don't know where she is!  DON'T PUT THAT THING ON ME! (slams the PHONE down) GONZO sits back in his chair... watching MISSION IMPOSSIBLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well.  That's that.  She's probably stuffing herself down the incinerator about now.  That's the last we should be hearing from Lucy. (fumbling with the hash pipe) Where's the opium? DUKE stares at the back of GONZO's neck.  SOMETHING VERY STRANGE IS HAPPENING TO HIM...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember slumping on the bed, his performance had given me a bad jolt. For a moment I thought his mind had snapped -- that he actually believed he was being attacked by invisible enemies.  But the room was quiet again. DUKE CLUTCHES THE BROWN BOTTLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you get this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never mind, it's absolutely pure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus... what kind of monster client have you picked up this time? There's only one source for this stuff -- the adrenaline gland from a living human body! GONZO turns to smile at DUKE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, but the guy didn't have any cash to pay me.  He's one of these Satanism freaks.  He offered me human blood -- said it would take me higher than I've ever been in my life. (laughs -- struts round DUKE -- eyes bright with expectation) I thought he was kidding, so I told him I'd just as soon have an ounce or so of pure adrenochrome -- or maybe just a fresh adrenaline gland to chew on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could already feel the stuff working on me -- the first wave felt like a combination of mescaline and methedrine -- maybe I should take a swim, I thought... DUKE sees that GONZO is TOYING WITH HIS HUNTING KNIFE...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, they nailed this guy for child molesting.  He swore he didn't do it. "Why should I fuck with children?" he says. "They're too small." Christ, werewolf is entitled to legal counsel.  I didn't dare turn the creep down. He might have picked up a letter opener and gone after my pineal gland! GONZO JABS WITH THE RAZOR BRIGHT KNIFE.  DUKE'S BODY IS GOING RIGID -- HE SPEAKS THROUGH GRITTED TEETH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?  We should get some of that.  Just eat a big handful and see what happens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (spitting words) Extract of pineal!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.  That's a good idea.  One whiff of that shit would turn you into something out of a goddamn medical encyclopedia. GONZO GROWS HORNS -- HIS FACE BECOMES A MEXICAN DEMON MASK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, your head would swell up like a watermelon, you'd probably gain about a hundred pounds in two hours... A CLOVEN HOOF BURSTS THROUGH GONZO'S SHOE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... grow claws... bleeding warts. GONZO'S CHEST EXPANDS -- BONY RIBS BURSTING HIS SHIRT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... then you'd notice about six huge hairy tits swelling up on your back... A TAIL LASHES, HOOFS STRIKE THE FLOOR.  GONZO TOWERS -- A FLAME RED DEMON!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fantastic! DUKE is now so wire that his hands are CLAWING UNCONTROLLABLY at the bedspread, JERKING IT RIGHT OUT FROM UNDER HIM.  His heels are dug into the mattress with both KNEES LOCKED, EYEBALLS SWELLING. GONZO-DEMON LOOMS AGAINST THE CEILING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you'd go blind... your body would turn to wax... they'd have to put you in a wheelbarrow and... GONZO'S VOICE FADES AWAY -- DUKE'S frenzied gaze reveals GONZO REVERTED TO NORMAL HUMAN SHAPE AND SIZE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man I'll try about anything; but I'd never touch a pineal gland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  What happened?!  What about the glands? GONZO, a small smile on his lips, backs away warily... towards the TV -- NOW A HUNDRED FEET AWAY IN THE DISTANCE...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, that stuff got right on top of you, didn't it. VEINS stand out on DUKE's forehead.  He is purplish-red. OVER THE TOP!  Too late, he realizes he is NEAR DEATH!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you could just... shove me into the pool, or something... GONZO shakes his head disgustedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I put you in the pool right now, you'd sink like a goddamn stone. You took too much.  Jesus, look at your face, you're about to explode. GONZO sits back down... watching the TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't try and fight it, or you'll get brain bubbles.  Strokes, aneurysms.  You'll just wither up and die. DUKE FALLS TO THE GROUND, WRITHING, CATATONIC, SINKING INTO PARALYSIS. AND THE SOUND, SUDDENLY AND STRANGELY, OF THE VOICE OF RICHARD NIXON AND HIS DISTORTED FACE ON THE TV SCREEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sacrifice... sacrifice... sacrifice... DUKE PASSES OUT. BLACK SCREEN 90. INT. FLAMINGO HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT Darkness.  Insanely, somewhere NILSSON plays -- "Put the lime in the coconut and mix em all up..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of rat-bastard psychotic would play that song -- right now, at this moment? DUKE opens his eyes and the hotel suite rushes in.  He lies, awkwardly twisted -- unable to move.  He could have been there days -- months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I came to the general back alley ambiance of the suite was so rotten, so incredibly foul.  How long had I been lying there?  Hours? Days?  Months?  All these signs of violence.  What had happened? DUKE moves his eyes -- taking in his surroundings: Like THE SIGHT OF SOME DISASTROUS ZOOLOGICAL EXPERIMENT involving whisky and gorillas.  Blue and red Christmas tree lights replace lightbulbs, used towels hanging everywhere, pornographic pictures ripped out of a magazine are plastered on a shattered mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was evidence in this room of excessive consumption of almost every type of drug known to civilized man since 1544 AD. DUKE manages to move -- stiffly gets to his bare feet -- HOBBLES ROUND THE TRASHED ROOM like a newly risen ape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what kind of addict would need all these coconut husks and crushed honeydew rinds?  Would the presence of junkies account for all these uneaten french fries?  These puddles of glazed ketchup on the bureau?  Maybe so, but then why all this booze?  And these crude pornographic photos smeared with mustard that had dried to a hard yellow crust... DUKE peers into Gonzo's room -- HIS BED LIKE A BURNED OUT RAT'S NEST -- blackened springs and wires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These were not the hoof prints of your normal god-fearing junkie.  It was too savage, too aggressive. QUICK FLASHBACK: GONZO SMASHES THE TEN FOOT MIRROR WITH A HAMMER: BACK IN THE ROOM: DUKE stares at the smashed mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grim memories and bad flashbacks. In the bathroom, DUKE'S unlaced boots CRUSH BROKEN GLASS IN VOMIT AND GRAPEFRUIT RINDS. DUKE unzips and pisses.  THERE IN THE TOILET BOWL IS THE MAGNUM .357!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something ugly had happened.  I was sure of it... DUKE stares at the golden stream SPLASHING ON THE GUN. The SOUNDS OF VOMITING come from a closet near the front door. DUKE looks into the room.  He sees GONZO's ass sticking out of the closet.  He opens his mouth to speak when, IN THE SMASHED MIRROR HE SEES THE FRAGMENTED REFLECTION OF HIMSELF... sleeping on the sofa. The ominous SOUND OF A KEY TURNING in the room lock. A hellish scream wakes up the SLEEPING DUKE.  He sees GONZO grappling naked with the maid -- gun to her head.  GONZO is muffling her screams with an ice bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please... please... I'm only the maid.  I didn't mean nothin!...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (jumps up from the bed, flashing his press badge)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to DUKE) She must have used a pass key.  I was polishing my shoes in the closet when I noticed her sneaking in-so I took her. DUKE shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (barks at the MAID) What made you do it?  Who paid you off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody.  I'm the maid!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're lying!  You were after the evidence.  Who put you up to this -- the manager?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit!  You're just as much a part of it as they are!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Part of what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dope ring.  You must know what's going on in this hotel.  Why do you think we're here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (blubbering) I know you're cops, but I thought you were just here for that convention.  I swear!  All I wanted to do was clean up the room.  I don't know anything about dope! GONZO laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, baby don't try to tell us you never heard of the Grange Gorman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  No!  I swear to Jesus I never heard of that stuff!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe she's telling the truth. Maybe she's not part of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  I swear I'm not!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (long pause) In that case, maybe she can help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes!  I'll help you all you need! I hate dope!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So do we, lady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (helping her up) I think we should put her on the payroll.  See what she comes up with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think you can handle it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One phone call every day.  Just tell us what you've seen.  Don't worry if it doesn't add up, that's our problem. GONZO hustles the MAID to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd pay me for that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're damn right.  But the first time you say anything about this, to anybody -- you'll go straight to prison for the rest of your life. What's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice.  Just ring Linen Service and ask for Alice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, Alice... you'll be contacted by Inspector Rock. Arthur Rock.  He'll be posing as a politician.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inspector Rock will pay you.  In cash.  A thousand dollars on the ninth of every month.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Lord!  I'd do just about anything for that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and a lot of other people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The password is: "One Hand Washes The Other." The minute you hear that, you say "I fear nothing."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fear nothing. She repeats the password several times while they listen to make sure she has it right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, and don't bother to make up the room.  That way we won't have to risk another of these little incidents, will we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever you say, gentlemen.  I can't tell you how sorry I am about what happened...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, it's all over now. Thank God for the decent people. She smiles, repeating to herself "One Hand Washes The Other" as GONZO hangs the DO NOT DISTURB sign and shuts the door. CUT BACK TO THE PRESENT. A grimy tape runs through a grunged-up portable tape recorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Thank God for the decent people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUKE sits in the middle of the wrecked suite with his mangled tape recorder in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Memories of that night are extremely hazy... DUKE fast forwards through the tape -- SEARCHING: "Awwww, mama... can this really...be the end...?" EXT. SAFEWAY SUPERMARKET - DAY The WHITE WHALE waits -- gleaming -- beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a definite obligation, when you boom around Vegas in a white Coupe de Ville, to maintain a certain style. DUKE and GONZO burst out of the supermarket riding a shopping basket loaded with COCONUTS, GRAPEFRUIT and TEQUILA.  They send DEFEATED SHOPPERS sprawling. The trolley collides into the WHITE WHALE.  SHOPPERS gather at the supermarket entrance to watch -- baskets loaded with junk, SCREAMING KIDS and EMPTY WALLETS. DUKE switches on the music: JUMPING JACK FLASH.  He selects a coconut -- ceremonially balances it on the hood.  GONZO pulls out a silver claw-hammer.  A sly look at the gathering CROWD... then he smashes the hammer down on the coconut! A GASP from the surly SHOPPERS. DUKE places another coconut.  SMASH!  Milk and white meat flies everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  Is that your car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure is. SMASH!  Coconut fragments fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any of you folks want the milk? We're after the meat.  This is honest coconut essence.  Real meat. SMASH!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meat, hell!  Look what you're doing to that car!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck the car.  They should make these things with a goddamn FM radio. SMASH!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeh... This foreign made crap -- is sucking our dollar balance dry!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone should stop them! SMASH!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You poor fools don't understand, do you?  This car is the property of the World Bank!  That money goes to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody should call the police!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Police?  Are you people crazy? GONZO confronts the CROWD, hammer in one hand, a coconut in the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You folks every heard of ole Patrick Henry?  Know what he said?! Silence -- the CROWD uncomprehending of this STONE DEGENERATE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ROARS)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! GONZO brings the hammer down on the hood.  CLANG! A gasp from the CROWD.  Getting ugly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Samoa we LOVE THE CONSTITUTION!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The CROWD move in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call the goddamn police! GONZO SWINGS THE HAMMER.  CLANG!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look what they've done to that beautiful car! DUKE jumps in behind the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This crowd is not rational.  They can't relate to us.  Let's go! A final CLANG!  GONZO jumps in. DUKE floors the accelerator -- screams at the CROWD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You people voted for Hubert Humphrey! You killed Jesus! They swerve round and through the CROWD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd broke ranks.  Nobody wants to be run over by a Coupe de Ville. INT. HOTEL FLAMINGO SUITE - NIGHT DUKE FAST-FORWARDS... PLAYS THE TAPE...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You found the American Dream?  In this town?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're sitting on the main nerve right now... INT. BAZOOKO CIRCUS REVOLVING MERRY-GO-ROUND BAR - NIGHT DUKE and GONZO (wearing a single black glove) talk conspiratorially to a 3RD MAN.  A PLACID ORANGUTAN in a bow tie sits next to him.  THE BAR IS REVOLVING FASTER THAN NORMAL.  DUKE IS INSANELY TALKATIVE -- WIRED!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The manager told me a story about the owner of this place...about how he always wanted to run away and join the circus when he was a kid. Well, now the bastard has his own circus, and a license to steal, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right -- he's the model.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely!  Pure Horatio Alger... Say... INT. FLAMINGO HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT DUKE playing the tape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... how much do you think he'd take for the ape? DUKE fast-forwards again -- searching... TRAFFIC NOISES. SCREECH OF BRAKES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy God!... A TERRIBLE GRINDING NOISE. EXT. CAR RENTAL AGENCY - NIGHT RENTAL AGENT Holy God!, how did this happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They beat the shit out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The top's completely jammed! The CAR RENTAL AGENT wrestles with the trashed car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, something's wrong with the motor... INT. FLAMINGO HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT DUKE ON TAPE ... The generator light's been on red ever since I drove the thing into Lake Mead on a water test...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A HUGE SPLASH... The tape's gone too far.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no.  Shit... DUKE races the tape BACKWARDS... Then, SIRENS HOWL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the ape?  I'm ready to write a check. INT. BAZOOKO CIRCUS BAR - NIGHT DUKE is standing in the middle of A SEMI-DESTROYED BAZOOKO CIRCUS REVOLVING BAR.  Mirrors are broken.  People are recovering from some kind of battle.  THE BAR SPINS MADLY. DUKE IS INSANELY WIRED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it, he just attacked an old man... he took a bite out of the bartender's head!  The cops took the ape away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamnit!  What's the bail?  I want that ape!  I've already reserved two first-class seats on the plane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was every reason to believe that we had been heading for trouble, that we'd pushed our luck a bit far... INT. WHITE WHALE ON THE STREETS OF LAS VEGAS - NIGHT GONZO SCREAMS ABUSE out of the window at a Ford alongside the VOMIT STREAKED WHITE WHALE.  DUKE MAKES A SUPERHUMAN EFFORT TO STAY ON THE ROAD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey there!  You folks want to buy some heroin? In the Ford: TWO COUPLES -- MIDDLE-AGED AMERICAN FACES FROZEN IN SHOCK -- stare straight ahead.  GONZO leans out -- close to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, honkies!  Goddamnit, I'm serious.  I want to sell you some pure fucking smack! No reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheap heroin!  This is the real stuff!  You won't get hooked.  I just got back from Vietnam!  This is scag, folks.  Pure scag! The lights change.  The Ford bolts.  DUKE keeps pace with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoot!  Fuck!  Scag!  Blood! Heroin!  Rape!  Cheap!  Communist! Jab it right in your fucking eyeballs! The MAN IN THE BACK SEAT suddenly loses control -- enraged, lunges against the glass, trying to get at GONZO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You dirty bastards!  Pull over and I'll kill you!  God damn you!  You bastards! INT. FLAMINGO HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT BACK IN THE SUITE: The tapes runs:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You dirty bastards! An ugly squeal of brakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, he was trying to bite me!  I shoulda maced the fucker! DUKE fast forwards the tape.  The TAPE MANGLES -- the sounds ski to a halt... DUKE grabs the nearest tool -- uses it to hook out the tape, then realizes... IT'S GONZO'S RAZOR-SHARP FOLDING KNIFE... A CHILLING MOMENT... DUKE turns the knife over... THERE'S A DRIED CRIMSON SPOT ON THE BLADE... OR IS IT DRIED MASHED POTATOES?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . READ ON TO FIND OUT!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (remembering) Back door beauty!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mentality of Las Vegas is so grossly atavistic that a really massive crime often slips by unrecognized. DUKE SCRAPS A LITTLE OF THE CRUST -- TASTES IT...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The possibility of physical and mental collapse is very real... No sympathy for the devil; keep that in mind.  Buy the ticket, take the ride... HE HEARS THE SOUNDS OF SOMEONE BEHIND BEATEN UP...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!  Faggot!  Bastard! EXT. NORTH STAR COFFEE LOUNGE - NIGHT WHACK!  SHADOWY FIGURES beat up a MAN -- give him A GOOD KICKING.  BRUTAL AND UGLY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: North Vegas is where you go when you've fucked up once too often on The Strip and when you're not even welcome in the cut-rate Downtown places. PAN to reveal a seedy diner -- THE NORTH STAR CAFE in the background.  Through the window -- DUKE and GONZO sit at the counter. INT. NORTH STAR COFFEE LOUNGE - NIGHT DUKE (V/O) The North Star Coffee Lounge seemed like a fairly safe haven from our storms.  No hassles, no talk.  Just a place to rest and regroup.  I wasn't even hungry. GONZO stuffs a hamburger down PAYING NO ATTENTION TO THE BEATING going on outside the window.  Duke reads a newspaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was nothing in the atmosphere of the North Star to put me on my guard...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to WAITRESS) Two glasses of ice water with ice. The WAITRESS brings the ice water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looked like a burnt out caricature of Jane Russell.  She was definitely in charge here... GONZO gulps down his glass of water and hands her a napkin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He did it very casually, but I knew that our peace was about to be shattered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that? GONZO shrugs. The WAITRESS stands at the end of the counter with her back to them while she ponders the napkin... She turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A napkin. THE WAITRESS slams the napkin down on the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't give me that bullshit!  I know what it means!  You goddamn fat pimp bastard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the name of a horse I used to own.  What's wrong with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sonofabitch!  I take a lot of shit in this place, but I sure as hell don't have to take it off a
direction.name: direction

result.heading: GIVE ME LIBERTY OR GIVE ME DEATH
THE BAR IS REVOLVING FASTER THAN NORMAL
A SEMI-DESTROYED BAZOOKO CIRCUS REVOLVING BAR
WHITE WHALE ON THE STREETS OF LAS VEGAS
DUKE MAKES A SUPERHUMAN EFFORT TO STAY ON THE ROAD

THERE'S A DRIED CRIMSON SPOT ON THE BLADE

result.heading: SCRAPS A LITTLE OF THE CRUST -- TASTES IT
HEARS THE SOUNDS OF SOMEONE BEHIND BEATEN UP
PAYING NO ATTENTION TO THE BEATING

direction.raw_text: . GONZO GOES VERY VERY STILL AT THIS...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.  I thought, what's happening? DUKE picks up the napkin.  On it is printed in careful red letters: "BACK DOOR BEAUTY?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The question mark was emphasized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (screams) Pay your bill and get the hell out! You want me to call the cops?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spic pimp? GONZO's hand goes inside his shirt.  He PULLS OUT THE RAZOR- SHARP HUNTING KNIFE. GONZO KEEPS HIS EYES ON THE WAITRESS.  He walks about six feet down the aisle and lifts the receiver of the pay phone. He SLICES IT OFF, then brings the receiver back to his stool and sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was stupid with shock -- not knowing whether to run or start laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (casual) How much is the lemon meringue pie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyes were turgid with fear, but her brain was functioning on some basic motor survival level.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (blurting -- on automatic) Thirty-five cents!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing) I mean the whole pie. The WAITRESS MOANS.  GONZO places a $5 BILL on the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's say five dollars.  Okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GONZO walks round the counter TAKING THE PIE OUT OF THE DISPLAY CASE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sight of the blade had triggered bad memories.  The glazed look in her eyes said her throat had been cut.  She was still in the grip of paralysis when we left. DUKE IS ROOTED TO THE SPOT. GONZO urges him out the door.  The camera retreats with them. The WAITRESS STANDS THERE -- PETRIFIED.  Alone in a lousy bar at night. INT. FLAMINGO HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT DUKE's face as he stares at the knife -- remembering...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drive!  Drive!  Drive!  We have fifteen fucking minutes to get me on that plane! EXT. ROAD ON OUTSKIRTS OF LAS VEGAS - DAY The WHITE WHALE, looking like shit -- it's TOP HALF UP, TORN, SLAPPING IN THE WIND -- ROARS THROUGH AN INTERSECTION as the light turns red. DR. GONZO FRANTICALLY PAWS OVER A MAP. DUKE drives -- SILENT AND FURIOUS -- sick to his stomach with the PSYCHOTIC GONZO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?  You were supposed to turn back there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had abused every rule that Vegas lived by -- burning the locals, abusing the tourists, terrifying the help.  The only chance now, I felt, was the possibility that we'd gone to such excess that nobody in the position to bring the hammer down on us could possibility believe it. DUKE suddenly SLAMS ON THE BRAKES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ!!! There, crossing the road in front of them, is LUCY -- her paintings under her arm -- looking lost.  SHE LOOKS UP WITH A VAGUE SENSE OF RECOGNITION... DUKE throws the car into a SKIDDING REVERSE TURN AND ROARS OFF. EXT. DESERT ROAD OUTSIDE LAS VEGAS - DAY THE WHITE WHALE TEARS DOWN THE DESERTED FREEWAY.  GONZO looks wildly around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamnit!  We're lost!  What are we doing out here on this godforsaken road? GONZO sees that THEY'RE RUNNING PARALLEL WITH THE AIRPORT RUNWAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The airport is over there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never missed a plane yet. DUKE HITS THE BRAKES and wrenches the wheel -- takes the WHALE down into the grassy freeway divider.  WHEELS CHURNING, HE MAKES IT UP THE OPPOSITE BANK, nose of the car straight up, then BOUNCES ONTO THE FREEWAY and keeps going right OVER A FENCE, dragging it through a cactus field and onto the RUNWAY. GONZO is FROZEN WITH FEAR -- GRIPPING THE DASHBOARD.  He throws a worried look at DUKE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll drop you right next to the plane. They SPEED UNDER A PARKED AIRPLANE, SHOUTING ABOVE THE JET ENGINE SCREAM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  I can't get out!  They'll crucify me.  I'll have to take the blame!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (irritatedly) Ridiculous!  Just say you were hitchhiking to the airport and I picked you up.  You never saw me before.  Shit, this town is full of white Cadillac convertibles.  I plan to go through there so fast that nobody will even glimpse the goddamn license plate.  You ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?  But for Christ's sake, just do it fast! EXT. AT THE AIRPLANE - DAY DUKE SCREECHES UP in front of the DESERT AIR 727.  GONZO JUMPS OUT -- HEADS FOR THE PLANE. DUKE watches him go -- RELENTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! GONZO stops -- turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't take any guff from those swine.  Remember, if you have any trouble you can always send a telegram to the Right People.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... Explaining my Position. Some asshole wrote a poem about that once... GONZO pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably good advice, if you have shit for brains. GONZO turns and RACES TOWARDS THE STEPS JUST AS HE IS ABOUT TO ENTER THE PLANE HE PAUSES AND LOOKS BACK...SMILES...AND LEANS FORWARD AND VOMITS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There he goes -- one of God's own prototypes -- a high powered mutant of some kind never even considered for mass production.  Too weird to live and too rare to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUKE watches for a second then ROARS AWAY.  PULL BACK WITH THE WHITE SHARK -- LEAVING THE AIRPLANE FAR BEHIND. INT. FLAMINGO HOTEL SUITE/APOCALYPSE - NIGHT On the TV an airplane soars thru the sky.  Pull back to find DUKE barricaded in GONZO'S BEDROOM.  He is typing on his typewriter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are all wired into a survival trip now.  No more of the speed that fueled that 60's.  That was the fatal flaw in Tim Leary's trip. He crashed around America selling "consciousness expansion" without ever giving a thought to the grim meat-hook realities that were lying in wait for all the people who took him seriously... DUKE records like A WAR CORRESPONDENT.  The CAMERA slowly rises -- DUKE alone in the room with the TV SPEWING OUT IMAGES OF WARS AND CIVIL UNREST OF THE 90'S.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All those pathetically eager acid freaks who thought they could buy Peace and Understanding for three bucks a hit.  But their loss and failure is ours too.  What Leary took down with him was the central illusion of a whole life-style that he helped create... RISING HIGHER -- THE WALLS OF THE ROOM APPEAR TO BY 20 TO 30 FEET HIGH.  DUKE SEEMS TO BE AT THE BOTTOM OF A WELL... THE CAMERA RISES UP THROUGH BROKEN TIMBERS...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... a generation of permanent cripples, failed seekers, who never understood the essential old-mystic fallacy of the Acid Culture: the desperate assumption that somebody... or at least some force -- is tending the light at the end of the tunnel. HIGHER STILL -- DUKE ALONE IN THE ROOM -- AN ISOLATED BOX SURROUNDED BY THE TWISTED METAL AND RUBBLE AND SMASHED NEON SIGNS OF THE DEAD CITY -- A BLASTED LANDSCAPE WITHOUT LIGHT -- SHARDS OF A CIVILIZATION.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. DESERT HIGHWAY - DAY A BURNING FLARED-OUT SUN.  The camera pans down to DUKE DRIVING THE WRECKED WHALE.  A piece of the fence flies out of the back seat as he takes a bump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was only one road back to L.A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Interstate 15, just a flat-out high speed burn through Baker and Barstow and Berdoo, then on to the Hollywood Freeway straight into frantic oblivion: safety, obscurity, just another freak in the Freak Kingdom. DUKE sees THE HARDWARE BARN, A RUSTIC OLD FARM BUILDING facing the road with a single gas pump outside and a neon sign that flashes beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhh.  Wonderful. DUKE PULLS OFF THE ROAD and parks.  Gets out and walks in. INT. HARDWARE BARN - BAKER, CALIFORNIA - DAY DUKE enters the DARK, CLUTTERED INTERIOR.  Scattered all about the store are BITS OF AMERICANA... OLD BARRELS, WAGON WHEELS, WOODEN YOKES.  A STUFFED HORSE HANGS FROM THE RAFTERS.  The sunlight shafts through high windows.  AN OLD MAN is repairing an iron pot-bellied stove near the wooden bar.  A NORMAN ROCKWELL PAINTING... ONLY REAL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'll you have? DUKE can't quite believe this place -- too good to be true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (doubtfully) Ballantine Ale...? THE PROPRIETOR serves the ale up ice cold.  DUKE SMILES AND RELAXES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hard to find it served like this anymore. As he drinks, DUKE toys with a rack of key chains -- LITTLE AMERICAN ICONS... A REMINGTON COWBOY, A BUGS BUNNY, A TWEETY PIE, BETTY BOOP, A BASEBALL PLAYER.  The logo on the rack reads: AMERICAN DREAM KEY RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where ya comin' from, young man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Las Vegas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A great town, that Vegas.  I bet you had good luck there.  You're the type.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.  I'm a triple Scorpio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trustingly) That's a fine combination.  You can't lose. A LOVELY GIRL appears.  Seeing DUKE, she smiles.  CAN THIS REALLY BE HIS LUCKY DAY?  She approaches him... and... KISSES THE PROPRIETOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (caught off guard... muttering) Oh, my God!...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not understanding) This is my granddaughter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (recovering) Don't worry... (leans forward in confidence) ... and I'm actually the District Attorney from Ignoto County. (winks) Just another good American like yourself. A MOMENT.  THE PROPRIETOR'S SMILE DISAPPEARS. Wordlessly the PROPRIETOR and his GRANDDAUGHTER go to the back of the store -- GET ON WITH THEIR WORK -- IGNORING DUKE. WHO FEELS ASHAMED. DUKE puts some money down on the bar and SLOWLY LEAVES. EXT. HARDWARE BARN - DAY A CHASTENED DUKE approaches the vomit streaked WHITE WHALE. Gets in -- sits there -- deflated -- miserable...
direction.name: direction
